observations are consistent with the hypothesis that SHBG, destined to participate in signaling at the cell membrane, is locally regulated and produced

Data suggest that O-glycosylation of sex hormone-binding gllobulin is essential for SHBG binding to a membrane receptor that is responsible for inhibiting the estradiol-induced proliferation of MCF-7 breast cancer cells.
2.35 A and 1.7 A crystal structures of the amino-terminal LG domain of SHBG. Resolution of a disordered region at the entrance of the human sex hormone-binding globulin steroid-binding site.

Results describe the crystal structure of human sex hormone-binding globulin in complex with 2-methoxyestradiol.

Data show that human sex hormone-binding globulin (SHBG) transcripts containing an alternative exon 1 sequence are located specifically in the testicular germ cells of transgenic mice, whereas murine SHBG transcripts are confined to Sertoli cells.

study shows that for patients with polycystic ovary syndrome, sex hormone-binding globulin is an integrated marker of insulin resistance that may be of use to identify insulin-resistant individuals for targeted treatment

IGFBP-1 and SHBG are equally sensitive to ambient insulin concentrations in human hepatoma cell cultures, and the production of both proteins is also attenuated by the IGFs.

Novel (TAAAA)n allele found in low frequency, mainly in controls. May be genetic contribution to decreased SHBG levels frequently seen in polycystic ovary syndrome(PCOS). May act as susceptibility gene, genetic link for origin.

Suggest that SHBG in women and testosterone in men may be inversely associated with diabetes.

data suggest that higher SHBG levels are associated with worse verbal memory.

After early childhood, serum sex hormone-binding globulin declines to a nadir in males at the age of 20 years and remains stable till the sixth decade with a gradual, progressive rise thereafter. In females, the sex hormone-binding globulin nadir is reached earlier with levels rising gradually and progressively with age thereafter and accelerating after the age of 70 years

SHBG overexpression reduced weight gain but did not change the metabolic profile of obese mice. SHBG down-regulation during obesity development involved changes in liver HNF4alpha and PPARgamma mRNA and protein levels.

higher SHBG (but not testosterone or estradiol) is an independent risk factor for vertebral fractures in older men.
two non-linked SNPs (rs6259 and rs9901675) at the SHBG gene locus might be of importance for language impairment problems in boys.

No significant differences were observed in serum ABP levels in all male farmers between the two groups with different fluoride exposure. These results supported that excess fluoride exposure decreased serum T levels of male farmers with age-specificity.

we genotyped five hormone-related genes: estrogen receptor-alpha (ESR1), aromatase (CYP19), catechol-O-methyl transferase (COMT), sex hormone-binding globulin (SHBG)and glutathione S-transferase (GSTP1).  Our data demonstrate that these ESR1, GSTP1, and CYP19 polymorphisms are associated with risk of BC, and the risk haplotype TGGGGTC could help to identify populations with high susceptibility to BC in Chinese women.

In hormonal contraceptive users, SHBG was positively associated with both activated protein C (APC) resistance and baseline TG, and protein S and prothrombin were important mediators. These data provide further evidence that SHBG may be used as a biomarker in assessing prothrombotic profile of hormonal contraception.
cross-sectional associations between individual bioavailable sex hormones and SHBG with radiographically assessed kyphosis, were examined.
Temporal change in serum SHBG, but not Testosterone, Estradiol, or other hormonal variables, was significantly associated with any, nonvertebral or hip fracture incidence in univariable analyses.

relationship of testosterone, sex hormone-binding globulin (SHBG), and IGF-1 with bone mineral density (BMD) and bone turnover markers (BTMs) in Korean men, is reported.

modulates hepatic lipogenesis; reduction of SHBG plasma levels in obese and type 2 diabetic subjects could be directly associated with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease development through an increase in hepatic lipogenesis

Data suggest there is a strong inverse correlation between SHBG (sex hormone-binding globulin) and DHEA (dehydroepiandrosterone) levels in cord blood obtained at birth from infants of both sexes; there are no associations between SHBG and testosterone or DHT (dihydrotestosterone) levels. This study was conducted in Sweden.

name: sex hormone binding globulin
summary: This gene encodes a steroid binding protein that was first described as a plasma protein secreted by the liver but is now thought to participate in the regulation of steroid responses. The encoded protein transports androgens and estrogens in the blood, binding each steroid molecule as a dimer formed from identical or nearly identical monomers. Polymorphisms in this gene have been associated with polycystic ovary syndrome and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2014].
